title: Lab 1: Building a Data Pipeline
text:
For this first lab, we analyze the changes of population for different Chicago neighborhoods between the years 2010 and 2020. We see that neighborhoods such as the Near North Side, the Near West Side, and Hyde Park grew overall in population. Others, such as Roseland and South Chicago actually shrank in population over the same period of time.1






Graphical representation of percent change in population based on data from ReferencesCCAProfiles20162020 file.








(Kling et al.) is my first source, and it is from an article in a scholarly journal. My second source, (Rohde), is from a website that I did not find to be very helpful. The book source that I just to sample here to practice references is (Voelker), and it was one of the most recent texts that I could find from a quick Google search.
iv) Produce a table that lists the names and percentage population change for those community areas with an increase in population of more than 10 percent.
v) Produce a table that lists the names and percentage population change for those community areas with an decrease in population of more than 10 percent.

In this Quarto Markdown document, use your visualization and two tables to write a short summary of population change for Chicago Community Areas.

title: Post-Assignment Reflection
text:
Highlight one or two things you are especially proud of regarding your submission. This could be a particular element within the assignment or could be part of your process (e.g.Â time management, applying new techniques, etc.).
If you were to start this assignment over again, what are one or two things that you might do differently?
Are there any aspects or areas in your submission where you would like us to focus our feedback?
On a scale of 1 to 10, please rate how ready you feel this work is for sharing with a public audience (where 1 is not at all ready to be shared and 10 is polished and ready for public dissemination). Briefly describe why you gave your work this rating.

Thank you for taking the time to evaluate your efforts. We look forward to sharing feedback with you soon!
